Where Essex leads

ESSEX is leading the way in the economic recovery, according to Prime Minister David Cameron.

At Prime Minister’s Questions earlier today local Essex MP, Priti Patel, asked Mr Cameron to support new infrastructure and highlighted the importance of the role that businesses play in Essex supporting economic growth, job creation and exports.

The PM added: “Where Essex leads the rest of the country follows”.

This was in response to a question from Priti Patel, on the economy and the falling unemployment rate in the county.  

David Cameron used Essex as a example of the Coalition’s economic policies pay-off and as a justification for a continued austerity programme.  Priti Patel said: “I am glad that the Prime Minister acknowledged the importance of businesses in my constituency, and across Essex.

'These comments will help in our campaign to get the much needed infrastructure to help promote further business growth, and to encourage local businesses to export nationally and globally.”

 

And Essex is indeed a leading element of the UK's ecomony delivery key business advantages and opportunities . . .

  • Home to the world's largest powered floor for mobile robots at the University of Essex
  • 70% of Essex advanced manufacturing firms export goods to every continent
  • Two-thirds of England's projected offshore wind installations by 2020 will be on its East Coast.
  • Essex has the second highest concentration of finance and insurance workers in the European Union with 66,000 workers, only second to London, which happens to be on our doorstep too
  • Essex is ranked number two in the UK for freight loading of trucks, 66m tonnes is loaded at Essex sites, growing year on year - a 38% increase in truck freight from 2010
  • Home to the London Gateway Logistics Park, the largest distribution park in Europe


[ Source: http://www.essexchronicle.co.uk/David-Cameron-Essex-leads-rest-country-follows/story-21255733-detail/story.html ]

David Rooke Inward Investment Manager

David Rooke

Inward Investment Manager

+44 (0) 7989 380435

Biography

In a career spanning over 30 years David’s experience includes large-scale factory management and 17 years in inward investment. David has worked with a wide range of major corporates and organisations in the UK and overseas, advising on inward investment projects, business relocations, expansion and consolidation projects.
